channel.title: To make the server read a shop?
channel.description: ok what do i search for in client.java in order to make the server read the shops?

item.title: To make the server read a shop?
item.dc:creator: @Eddie12390 Eddie12390
item.description:
@Eddie12390 wrote:

for the first one that has // shop beside it, im pretty sure it should start with } else if

Also, if you want to add another, copy the data from the aubury shop and paste it under the aubury shop except edit it to fit that shop.

For me, when i search shops I have like 4 shop portals, so it wouldn’t work for me to search for // shops

Read full topic
item.source: To make the server read a shop?

item.title: To make the server read a shop?
item.dc:creator: @Dreaded_Such Dreaded Such
item.description:
@Dreaded_Such wrote:

lol thanks d00d!~ your awesome btw its acutally alot easier to search “//shops” in the client.java cause when i searched “WanneShop” it didnt take me to it, it went to 2 other differnt places and when i search"//shops" it went right to it, it must be my source lul[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 11, 2008, 04:15:00 pm[/size][hr]i got this ?

if (NPCID == 502) { // Shop
PutNPCCoords = true;
WanneShop = 3; //Donie
} else if (NPCID == 553) {
// Aubury rune shop
PutNPCCoords = true;
WanneShop = 1; // Aubury Magic Shop

is there anything i need to change? for differnt shops?

Read full topic

item.title: To make the server read a shop?
item.dc:creator: @Eddie12390 Eddie12390
item.description:
@Eddie12390 wrote:

I would search for “WanneShop =” inside client.java so that you can find the exact place to add it

} else if (NPCID == ###) { // NPC ID goes after the two ==, replace the #'s, your probably going to need the } else
PutNPCCoords = true; // i forget what this does
WanneShop= 41; // The shop ID

Dunno if you read the edited post above.

Read full topic
